FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
  CHARACTER(LEN=32) :: bin_str
  INTEGER :: i, pos
  bin_str = ''
  IF (n == 0) THEN
    bin_str = '0'
    RETURN
  END IF
  pos = 0
  DO WHILE (n > 0)
    pos = pos + 1
    bin_str(pos:pos) = ACHAR(ICHAR('0') + MOD(n,2)) n = n / 2
  END DO
  ! Reverse the string
  bin_str = reverse(bin_str(1:pos))

FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
  CHARACTER(LEN=32) :: bin_str
  INTEGER :: i, len
  bin_str = '' IF (n == 0) THEN
    bin_str = '0'
    RETURN
  END IF
  len = 0
  DO
    bin_str(len+1:len+1) = ACHAR(ICHAR('0') + MOD(n,2))
    n = n / 2
    len = len + 1
    IF (n == 0) EXIT

  ! Reverse the string

Function to convert integer to binary string (without leading zeros):

FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
  CHARACTER(LEN=32) :: bin_str
  INTEGER :: i, pos
  bin_str = ''
  IF (n == 0) THEN
    bin_str = '0'
    RETURN
  END IF
  pos = 0
  DO WHILE (n > 0)
    pos = pos + 1
    bin_str(pos:pos) = ACHAR(ICHAR('0') + MOD(n,2))
    n = n / 2
  END DO
  ! Reverse the string
  bin_str = reverse(bin_str(1:pos))
END FUNCTION

FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
  CHARACTER(LEN=32) :: bin_str
  INTEGER :: i, pos
  bin_str = ''
  IF (n == 0) THEN
    bin_str = '0'
    RETURN
  END IF
  pos = 0
  DO
    pos = pos + 1
    bin_str(pos:pos) = ACHAR(ICHAR('0') + MOD(n,2))
    n = n / 2
    IF (n == 0) EXIT
  END DO
  ! Reverse the string
  bin_str = bin_str(1:pos)
  bin_str = bin_str(pos: -1:1)  ! Reverse
END FUNCTION

A helper function to replace characters:

FUNCTION replace_0_1(s) RESULT(new_s)
  CHARACTER(LEN=*), INTENT(IN) :: s
  CHARACTER(LEN=LEN(s)) :: new_s
  INTEGER :: i
  DO i = 1, LEN(s)
    IF (s(i:i) == '0') THEN
      new_s(i:i) = '4'
    ELSE IF (s(i:i) == '1') THEN
      new_s(i:i) = '7'
    END IF
  END DO
END FUNCTION

program main

  implicit none

  integer, parameter :: max_u_length = 4

  integer :: N, i, input_num, mask, zeros, len_sub, ans, ios

  double precision :: total_sum, x(1000) ! assuming N is up to 1000

  character(len=20) :: sum_str, char1, new_char

  character(len=max_u_length) :: u(1000)

  ! Read N and the data

  read(*,*) N

  do i = 1, N

     read(*,*) x(i), u(i)

  end do

  ! Compute the sum

  total_sum = 0.0d0

  do i = 1, N

     if (trim(u(i)) == 'JPY') then

        total_sum = total_sum + x(i)

     else

        total_sum = total_sum + x(i) * 380000.0d0

     end if

  end do

  ! Convert to string and process second step

  write(sum_str, '(g0)') total_sum

  char1 = sum_str(1:1)

  new_char = char(ichar(char1) + 1)

  input_num = ichar(new_char) - ichar('0')

  ! Process third step

  ans = -1

  mask = 2

  do

     ! Convert mask to binary string

     bin_str = int_to_bin(mask)

     substr = bin_str(2: len_trim(bin_str))

     len_sub = len_trim(substr)

     zeros = count( substr == '0' )

     if (2*zeros /= len_sub) then

        mask = mask + 1

        cycle

     end if

     new_str = replace_0_1(substr)

     read(new_str, *, iostat=ios) value

     if (ios /= 0) then

        mask = mask + 1

        cycle

     end if

     if (value >= input_num) then

        ans = value

        exit

     end if

     mask = mask + 1

  end do

  ! Output the answer

  print*, ans

contains

  function int_to_bin(n) result(bin_str)

    integer, intent(in) :: n

    character(len=32) :: bin_str

    integer :: pos, i

    bin_str = ''

    if (n == 0) then

       bin_str = '0'

       return

    end if

    pos = 0

    do

       pos = pos + 1

       bin_str(pos:pos) = achar(ichar('0') + mod(n,2))

       n = n / 2

       if (n == 0) exit

    end do

    ! Reverse the string

    bin_str = bin_str(1:pos)

    bin_str = bin_str(pos: -1:1)  ! Reverse

  end function int_to_bin

  function replace_0_1(s) result(new_s)

    character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

    character(len=len(s)) :: new_s

    integer :: i

    do i = 1, len(s)

       if (s(i:i) == '0') then

          new_s(i:i) = '4'

       else if (s(i:i) == '1') then

          new_s(i:i) = '7'

       else

          new_s(i:i) = s(i:i)  ! shouldn't happen

       end if

    end do

  end function replace_0_1

end program main
